key_mistakes.reason: Black neglects the control of the center, allowing White to gain a space advantage.
This move prematurely opens the center without completing development.
Passive development, delaying natural knight development.
Black misplaces the queen, exposing it to potential harassment.
This move neglects the opportunity to capture a central pawn.
This move unnecessarily opens the position, leading to a loss of material.
This move allows White to gain a significant lead by opening lines.
This move loses tempo as White can easily counter it.
Black's queen is misplaced, leading to vulnerabilities.
This move opens the king's side, leading to a quick mate.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center early in the opening.
Prioritize development of minor pieces before moving the queen.
Ensure king safety by not opening unnecessary lines.
Avoid premature pawn moves that open the position without sufficient control.
